title: Meh. Awkward to get to turn a light on or off.
text:
Software usually works but to switch lights in and off, you have to burrow to the system, then a room, then pick lights. Long way to go. If you want to switch another light on or off, back up to the rooms, then down to lights in that room. You can pick favorites, but I don’t see how that short cuts anything.  

C4’s app is somewhat better. Room, lighting, then all lights on the system appear on the same screen. 

Please reorganize and rewrite this app!

title: Horrible company - many failures
text: I remodeled a new home. Bought for $60+K of Lutron gears (Radio Ra2): NOTHING works as promised. They refuse to fix their problems, keep pointing fingers (not our fault, the dealer is the guilty party). I used 3 different dealers: same stories. One of them even took $2K from me to place the order for an automated shade, Lutron apparently canceled him out as a dealer after accepting the order and I never got my $2K bac (nor the shade!!!). Sensors are horrible (don't work as promised - get confused - randomly trigger,..,). Switches have random issues. Some lights stay on 24h a day or don't turn on... believe me you don't want to buy anything from them. The only thing they do well is take your money and tell you it is not their problem...

title: Avoid.  Company uses mafia tactics and crap apps
text:
Top engineering. Worst delivery of luxury goods I’ve ever experienced. 

Five-digit sum for the Lutron Installation and then apps that keep being rendered obsolete.  Stay away from Lutron unless you’re made of millions and your time (or your staff’s time) means nothing to you. 

Lutron sits on well-earned patents, stifling competition.  They have good engineering.  You order the product and pay through the nose, only to later be told that any problems you have are due to the customer’s bad planning and the installer’s installation.  And the apps are hit-and-miss.

But they know they’ve got us all by the balls because the equipment is already installed.  They’ll probably respond to this with a “please contact us to make it right”.  Why should I?  So I can pay $2000 yet again for a 20-minute issue that should’ve been covered in the installation or, at most, cost an extra tenth of that?

Nope, won’t contact you or the installation.  I’ll just keep telling others the truth about your business model.  Bait.  Switch.  Cha-Ching.

title: Save the cloudless app!! Our clients don't want cloud!
text:
This app is massively better than Connect for doing live scene settings.  Lutron, at least let us keep using this app inside the home on the local network!  And our high net worth clients do not want to be on any cloud.  They use Home+ through their VPN and don't need or want to use a cloud they don't control due to security risk. 

Save the cloudless app!!

title: Must use PPTP to connect?! Wow!!!!
text: What a BS app! I purchased this app thinking that I'd be able to connect to my Radio Ra 2 system via my iPhones IPSEC VPN connection. When I couldn't get the app to connect to my main repeater I realized the brain dead programmers at Lutron only specified the repeater to accept an PPTP connection. You have to buy the router than Lutron specifies in order for this to work which is a Linksys or DLink. Honestly if you can afford to purchase and have a Radio Ra 2 in your house you are more than likely running something more robust than one of these sub $200 routers. This just doesn't make any sense and I hope others take notice because being able to control your lights when your not home is the main appeal of this app and this system. Lutron here is your wake up call - IMPROVE YOUR NETWORKING FUNCTIONALITY! By one very disappointed and loud customer.

title: Watch App Removed, Why?
text:
Been using the app for 6+ years. Loved the addition of the watch app and not having to fish out my iPhone just to hit a scene button. Now I see it’s gone? Why? I never had an issue or problem, and now, just like that, without warning, it’s gone. Might need to figure out a different solution...

UPDATE: After receiving a response from customer service, I see they want me to spend more money with them and an “installer” just to get back what I already had! I can see now why so many people are dissatisfied with this company.

title: Wish I had gone with cheaper better version
text: This works with Control 4 to provide terrible consistency.  Presently my Control 4 clock is off and so asking for the blinds to come up at 4pm means they might come up around 5:40 give or take 30 minutes. However on my other set of shades the clock is perfect, so I’m not sure if the blame is Luton or Control 4.  Either way I have to pay $200 to have someone come out to trouble shoot the system. Horrible Lutron software. Works  sometimes and it doesn’t other times. I can’t control the lights in my house through the app. At home or abroad. It asks me to buy a subscription. A complete waste of money.  Lutron doesn’t stand behind their product or support it.

title: DO NOT DOWNLOAD!
text:
This update removes the features that encompass the entire reason I selected Lutron.  I am now seeking proposals to remove all the RadioRA2 gear, sell it on eBay, and put in any competing system that does not treat their customers like we are incapable of simple tasks.  To be clear, this update removes the feature allowing an end user to tweak the lighting levels in their button panels.  I have scenes and lighting levels that I adjust seasonally.  I have timers and modes that I enable when I travel.  I now am unable to adjust lighting levels for thesis buttons, and am also unable to tell Lutron that I am "away" thus enabling my custom timers to mimic the behavior of being home.  I have no idea why Lutron would remove such useful functionality, other than to generate revenue for their installers (who are too busy to come over to make such minor tweaks), or if it's simply that they think the end user is too stupid to handle basic features.  
The ability to do these things from the iPad app was highlighted as a key feature in the marketing material and was a primary reason I selected Lutron.  I will never buy another product from them again unless this gets fixed within the next 90 days (the amount of time it will take me to select and schedule an installation of a competing product).  Avoid Lutron, avoid this app,  and best of luck if you are already a member of their proprietary, locked-down pergatory.

title: Awkward protocols
text: Lutron has this "reinvent the wheel" design philosophy with the RA2 so, although the user interface is very nice, some things end up working worse than average.  To use this app you specify separate telnet logins for the main repeater for each iPhone/iPad. Actually you have to reveal your password to your dealer/installer since Lutron does not release the main repeater programming software to homeowners.  The static IP in the main repeater also can only be changed by the dealer because this is configured by the programming software, so you can't manage your own network without babysitting from your dealer.  Lutron should have implemented a protocol that can share a login with multiple devices (not telnet) and allow the homeowner to enter logins and change static IP without the dealer involved. I got this working on a router with Tomato firmware so this will work across different types of routers. Note: you must configure one of the hardware keypads in the programming software in order to avoid a configuration error, even if the iPad/iPhone is your only keypad. Overall nice system but Lutron has to stop this "it's not good if it's not invented here" mentality in their software department.

title: Too slow and expensive
text:
It is too slow to connect. Remember, this is a paid expensive application, not a freebie which it should have been in first place.

If you can't set up VPN, and want control your system from outside you will need to pay extra $59 per year. Let's face it, this system is for home use and advertised and sold under pretense that you will be able to control your system from anywhere. Technically, it is true but very conveniently left out the fact that it will require VPN which most home user will not have due to dynamic IP and complicated setup. So now after few long years they decided to offer alternative without VPN but with a fee of $59 per year.

Also, you will have to make sure your RadioRA 2 software is the latest version 6.0 or it will not work. You will have to call your Lutron rep to upgrade the software as they don't let you do that in your own. This will take another 24 hours at least if you are lucky.

Update:  just found out about Nest Thermostat. The app for the Nest does not cost anything and there is no yearly fee for remote access.  So if you are looking for remote access for only thermostat there is better and cheaper alternative out there.

title: Much better on iPad
text:
So I love my Lutron system and controlling it from my phone always gets oohs and aahs at partys, however... 
On the iPad there is a much more useful layout that includes a button called "whole home". This allows me to see all light and shade control in one screen.  Unfortunately the iPhone version doesn't have this, so I am forced to continually have to page back to select my room and then individual light control.
Doesn't sound like a big deal, but when you are controlling over 20 Lutron lights and shades, it gets a bit tedious. 
Lutron please add this feature layout to the iPhone version and I'll gladly up my star rating.  Thanks.

title: Works as advertised
text:
I am an authorized installer… and I install other audio/video & control equipment.  Everything has an app now and some of them work well.  The good ones are responsive, accurate, and don't crash.  The bad ones provide something less than that. This one works… it provides a level of usability that doesn't exist in the Lutron systems without the app too.

To the guy that said it didn't work after spending $10k - I say, get a new installer.  Call Lutron - they will provide you a name of a certified installer like myself who can make it work, fix your network, or whatever else it takes.  It's highly unlikely to be an app issue.

title: This is what the app should have been originally
text: I decided to wait to review this app until the latest update with the newest features for editing the programming on keypads was released. Since the 8.0 firmware in RA2 and HWQS this app finally lives up to what I expected it to accomplish. As a dealer, installer, programmer it is very exciting that we can finally put full customization into the hands of the homeowner. They love it and it cuts down on service calls. Would have given it 5 stars but the price is still a crime. $20 for the app per plus $60/year for a remote access subscription? Shameful it's gotta be that way.

title: Must have for RadioRA2 systems
text: A little bit pricey considering you already paid thousands for your system, but this app is very useful to control your house from your smart devices. It also allows you to add more scenes that would otherwise require an extra keypad/button. The GUI is OK, nothing fancy, but it works well. I use it when I am in bed if I forget lights on or when outside at the pool. Works locally only unless you purchase a DDNS feature from Lutron. If you know how to create a VPN tunel on your home network amd have DDNS, then you can do it yourself.

title: Nice idea, bad business model
text: Useful app on legacy iPhones but expensive. Crashes on 6, 6+. Requires local electrician to upgrade Radio RA 2 firmware, integrate new hardware (light switches, etc), and set up special password to use certain app features. Lutron desperately needs to provide consumers with full feature interface to self manage Radio RA 2 in order to stay competitive. Why nickle and dime consumers when they already paid thousands for hardware and installation? Make the app more consumer centric (free and full feature) and demand for Radio RA 2 products will increase benefiting consumers, electricians, distributors, and Luton. Also, it would be nice if Luton updated the app so it works on current iPhones :)

title: Stopped working, Apple Watch app seems broken
text: As others have noted, once you install this version the app seems to no longer connect to your Lutron repeaters. I found that doing a hard reset of the main repeater (unplugging for 5 seconds) solved that. The Apple Watch app loads and while I can add specific lights or shades to my Apple Watch "favorites" I'm unable to add Scenes for some reason (selection state won't work after it tells you to select an icon), which pretty much renders it useless for my setup. Please fix, Lutron! This will be my most useful Watch App once it works!

title: BEST UPDATE EVER!!
text: So I've been a fan of our radiora2 system since it was installed about a year and a half ago... And with each update comes minor improvements.  This update has provided the BEST update yet... The ability to add and remove switches from scenes!! In the past, you could only edit the dinner settings of a scene... Now, in addition, you can add or remove specific switches. Almost no need for the software now!!  HUGE THANK YOU for the update Lutron!!

title: Worst Update Ever (Updated)
text:
UPDATE: Emailed app support and found out that there now is a switch in the app settings that defaults the edit function to off.  You must go to the Settings page, look for the Home + app and set the edit toggle to on. So far all seems to work.

Instead of adding more functionality they took valuable functionality away. All edit functions have been deleted. Guys you need to get with program.  Do Not Update until they get this fixed.

title: Swing and a... foul ball
text:
First of all, it needs to be FREE!

Lutron, You'll get your $ from those that sign up for remote login. Either that or create in-app purchase to activate scene editing. 

Fairly easy to use and edit lighting scenes however there isn't a way to add lighting loads to scenes that weren't originally programmed using the configuration software. 

HVAC control capabilities are ok but seem to respond wonky. Feedback doesn't always emulate what the Honeywell T-Stat does and sometimes requires 2 button presses. 

I REALLY don't like the fact that temperature icons show up in areas that don't have HVAC. Why do I need temperature controls in my Landscape zone?? HVAC icon should only show up in room that has the thermostat!! Not in unrelated rooms. 

I also don't like that all controlled devices use a lightbulb icon. I have fans and relays on the system and by them being listed as lights causes confusion. 

Still, a reasonable effort but doesn't stand out against competing platforms. Get to work Lutron!!

title: Not Worth Using
text:
This app is so tedious to use, it isn’t worth the effort. I can use my Lutron’s old, non-mobile web server on my iPhone faster than this app! So now I’m paying for a worse experience than an old, out-of-date, non-mobile web server.

One has to navigate by floor, then room, then switch, then click the desired button. Just to turn a light on. Nope.

You can make only one plate/switch a favorite and that’s it. So your Lutron experience is spent navigating back and forth in text menus.

Why can’t we favorite a bunch of buttons that all appear on a favorites panel? That alone would make this app usable. But instead, Lutron wants us to pay an installer to make a panel of favorites, which we can only update with a programmer visit. What a pain - no thank you.

Come on Lutron, step up to the plate and make an app that’s easy and efficient. This one isn’t.

title: FIX IT!!!!
text:
overall an ok app. I wish the interface was a little more geared towards seeing multiple switches in a room at once. 

However, since the last update of iOS it STOPPED WORKING. I found this out while away for a long weekend and now have no control of the house lighting.  Since I don't have the away function programmed yet I turn lights on and off from afar to simulate someone being home. 

Please fix this asap.

title: Rip off
text: Lutron makes enough on their ridiculously expensive switches, blinds and other products to provide this basic, sophmoric application that looks like it was written by a couple college kids for a nominal charge.  $60/year isn't expensive, but makes your stomach turn after investing in such an expensive system designed and marketed for remote control, only to be stuck on the backend with essentially an 'annual fee' for the priviledge of using their own products.  And same annual charge whether you have 5 lights or 5,000 lights, blinds, thermastats and other devices. Bad karma and bad business.

title: Lighting/Shades
text: I would say that when it comes to lighting controls and shade motorization/automation, Lutron has set the standard for reliable comunication and quality. Good luck with other systems that roam in the "High End" sphere and fall very short with poor comunication, bugs, glitches and multiple freezes wich turn your day into hell in a matter of minutes.

title: I don't think Lutron cares that it's a bad app
text: Have struggled with this app for over two years now. HORRIBLE.  Go away for three weeks and look at the house using our cameras I see some lights come on and others not come on at scheduled times. Hours of difference. Same with going off. What good is it to have a light come on in the middle of the day? Recheck the schedules on my IPad and they are fine, but the lights don't follow the schedule. If Lutron cared they would fix the app. Look for something else if you can. Including the light switch.

title: Scene editing
text:
The software would be very useful if you could use it to add or remove lighting loads when editing a scene.  Currently it is only possible to change a light level when editing a scene. 

To add or remove a lighting load from a scene I currently have to schedule an appointment with my Home Automation installer and that really bothers me.  I wish it was something I could do on my own.

title: Non-intuitive, needs more flexibility and customization
text:
• It takes way too many clicks to get to the light you want, in a specific room, on a specific floor.
• You can't make a custom list of your favorite lights or scenes; you can only favorite a specific button panel that already physically exists.
• No ability to customize which lights correspond to specific buttons on an existing button panel.
• This app should also be free if you already have Lutron hardware; it's a waste of money as-is.

title: Very convenient!

Now i save the iphone app for the end of the demo....., that is when i get the biggest "wow". 
Tim Ryan

title: So so

Lytton acknowledged this issue but the current up ate to 3.2 does not address it.

The hardware buttons work but they raise all shades at once. Only the software allows complete control that you need. Stay alert.

title: Lutron is all about the $
text:
I have several control keypads, but also like the option of controlling from my iPhone and iPad. 

Pros- the best thing is to be able to set and change the scene levels from the app.  If you don't have the app, you have to have a tech set them and you are stuck.  So pay the 20, it is cheaper then the service call.  

Cons- with what the system costs, it is a ripoff to have to pay 20 for the app.  At 175 to 400 for light switches and key pads, toss it in.  It is worthless to anyone that does not have the system, so who cares.  That said, with what I paid for the system, what's another 20.  

My biggest complaint is that Lurton wants you to have to call your dealer and line their pocket anytime you want to program or change something.  All switches and shades should be accessible from the app and the user should be able to add them or remove them from a scene.  

This is an even bigger annoyance because my dealer is horrible and I am stuck calling them to make a change.  They have the program and how it is set.  To get someone else to do it I have to call another dealer and they would need to reprogram it all.  

Lurton has a great product, but it is designed to protect their dealers.   I have tried to get in touch with someone at lutron to discuss my dealer but you cannot get through to anyone that matters.

I digress, basically, if you have the system, you need the app.  Pay the 20, don't pay 60 per year more for remote.  That is a ripoff solely for lutron to keep making money.  

If you have not gone with the ra2 yet, go with something else.  There are systems just as good that cost less and are mores end user friendly.

title: Sluggish, Expensive and Just Awful
text:
I purchased this app because we have a Lutron system, and not a day goes by when we don't complain about it. The app itself is slow to load, ludicrously expensive at $59.99 / year, and ultimately offers less customization that good ole plug-in vacation timers. 

Lutron insults their customers two ways: first, they don't allow you to customize your own system (you have to put in a service call to one of their Lutron technicians at $100+ an hour for any modifications), and second you are reminded of the lack of customization every single time you log into the app.

For instance, I wanted to create a new away mode "scene." I am not talking major changes to the program here. All I want to do is set up an occasional vacation mode using the app. Imagine paying thousands of dollars for a system, and the app won't even let you program a vacation mode! It's utterly maddening. 

Of course, you can chose not to purchase the app, and then you are left with a bunch of hand-operated light switches that cost you thousands of dollars. 

As soon as we can find another home automation system that suits our needs, we're ripping this stuff out, and starting anew. This app and it's costs are simply awful. For the amount of money the system costs we shouldn't be nickeled and dimed just to use it.
